compute_covar_DeltaSigma module¶

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.cleaned_precision_matrix(cov)[source]¶

zero-out noisy modes

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.comoving(redshift, Omega_m=0.3)[source]¶

compute comoving radial distance to redshift ‘redshift’ in flat LCDM.

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.compute_signal_to_noise(cov, signal)[source]¶

compute the signal-to-noise for the fiducial case.

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.cov_signal_restrict_scales(cov, signal, bins, rp_min=0.0, rp_max=inf)[source]¶

return cov, wp restricted to scales rmin < rp < rmax

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.extend_pk_range(k, pk, extended_kmax=1000.0)[source]¶

extend tabulated input power spectrum pk(k) to k_max using k^-3 asymptotic expansion

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.lensing_covariance(k, Pk_gm, Pk_gg, Pk_mm, bins, n_gal=0.001, Omega_M=0.3, H_0=100.0, L_W=500.0, DeltaPi=400.0, critical_density=4700.0, n_source=8.0, shape_noise=0.21, R=1275.0, gamma_t=True)[source]¶

compute the integral of Bessel functions over the galaxy power spectrum AND the matter power spectrum: int (dk k / 2pi) J_2(k r_p,i) J_2(k r_p,j) (P_gal(k) + 1/_ngal)(P_shear(k) + const.)

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.lensing_signal(k, pk_gm, bins, critical_density, Omega_M=0.3, H_0=100.0, gamma_t=True)[source]¶

compute the integral of bessel functions over the galaxy power spectrum AND the matter power spectrum to obtain the tangential excess shear signal.

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.main(parameter_file, pk_gg_filename, pk_gm_filename, pk_mm_filename, output_lensing_filename, output_lensing_precision, output_lensing_signal, output_lensing_nointrinsic_filename, gamma_t=None)[source]¶
compute_covar_DeltaSigma.measurement_bins(rmin=0.5, rmax=30.0, nbins=30)[source]¶
compute_covar_DeltaSigma.my_sinc(x)[source]¶
compute_covar_DeltaSigma.pi_lens(z_lens, z_source, Omega_m=0.3)[source]¶

compute pi_lens (eq. 18 in my notes) assuming a single source and single lens redshift.

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.supersample_and_extend_pk(k, pk)[source]¶
compute_covar_DeltaSigma.supersample_pk(k, pk, supersample_factor=10)[source]¶

supersample pk by cubic spline interpolation

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.survey_radius(degrees_sq, redshift, Omega_m=0.3)[source]¶

compute the comoving survey radius assuming a spherical cap survey of ‘degrees_sq’ square degrees on the sky at redshift ‘redshift’.

compute_covar_DeltaSigma.window(k, R=1275.0)[source]¶

this is the window function for a circular survey of projected comoving radius R
